reviewText:
If you get it from a bundle, and you'd like to have ~ 1-1.5 hours of casual platforming in retro style, go for it. Don't mind this review if you're intrested in gameplay-releated review, as it's okay.

But I'm not willing to rate this game positive. Hit detection is indeedwonky  - I've got killed by shots what was going above my hat, while I killed zombie-dogs (?) who was basically *inside* me and still survived.
But my main gripe is game design. Level design is okay, most levels can be easily completed within the time limit - but game design.
-There's no way to exit the game unless you start a game - no escape option in menu, and neither escape button works.
-The game's controls are simple (4 directons+jump+hit) but one can not rebind the buttons. And while X-Y is a common pick for the old A B buttons, my qwertz keyboard begs to differ that this is the best available option. Yes, I know I can change it to english with shift-alt as I've done it, but still - non-rebindable controls should be forbidden in 2015.
voteText: 13 of 21 people (62%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText: It's a run around and collect things game, one that reminds me a small amount of Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure on Game Boy, if anyone remembers it.  This is a lot easier, though, since you've got offensive capabilities with your hat.  You can use it to kill enemies, or to reflect shots back.  It's nice looking, and it's got really cheery music.  The only gripe is that it's pretty short, so unless you're planning on perfecting your runs, it's probably only going to last you under an hour.  Still, I enjoyed it while it lasted.

reviewText:
- This review isn't written by a native speaker, thank you for your understanding -

Rating Must Play !

- Key features below ---- Review after -----------------------------------------------
Play time needed (perfect) about 1 hours
Gaming level Casual
Achievement level from Casual (+) to Gamer (-)
Game style Platformer
Game modes Story mode
Graphics Very good.
Story A few about it.
Playthrough 1
Music Very good.
Controls Keyboard (no key binding possible)
Tutorial Shown as information panels
Unmissable / backtracking content Refer to (#) at the end of the review.
Glitches / bugs One good, refer to (*) at the end of the review.
Worth price It worth its full price. Have a look at the (#) point.

- Review below ----------------------------------------------------------------------
It's really a very good platformer game, we would be pleased to have some more slideshow that relate the story and ahy not a sequel of this game ?

We just know that Job the Leprechaun need to save his friend Eri and will know which one kidnapped him by play the different levels.

The game features 2 worlds for 35 levels this includes normal levels, bosses levels and a bonus level.

The aim of the game is to clear each normal level by collecting all the clovers and reaching the door which appears after having all clovers. Of course the is some platforming, fighting and some puzzle to make your journey challenging. There is also a time limit to finish each normal and boss level. Hopefully Job is resourceful : he can use his hat to knock out foes and can also reflects with it fire balls. Job is not alone, several big ears Leprechauns, plants and cows will help him through his journey. Finally you begin the game with 3 lives and can acquire several more in some challenging area or in some trees.

You can always quit the game and resume where you left it but beware to not press enter before choosing Continue instead of the default choice of New game. The game isn't too long, less than an hour is enough to beat the game.

(#):
One achievement is earned after finishing the game (easy difficulty) and another one is earned after finishing the game without using a continue (medium difficulty). At the beginning I didn't really got it, but after finishing the game I can confirm that a continue is granted when you have lost all your lives. So it's really easy to finish the game.

(*):
Even it's still difficult for you to finish the game without using any continue you can save some lives by escaping the game before your life is taken and resume the game. But this is mostly doable when you fell off the screen or running out of time and hard to make in the other cases.

reviewText:
A simple platform game that reminds me of the early SNES era, good but essentially too short to have a lasting impression, you can expect to complete this in about an hour.

The graphics here aren’t that fancy but they get the job done, if you didn’t like them in the screenshots, they won’t fare any better in game. The music, however limited in variety was catchy enough to listen to; chip tunes were a befitting choice for this retro title.

When it comes down to the game play, you can anticipate 31 levels spread across two worlds, where you have to control the Leprechaun to collect all four leaf clovers while avoiding the witch’s mooks. There are also 2 boss battles that was a bit underwhelming in difficulty, along with 1 bonus level where you control the cow in a quick sprint for clovers.

If you are familiar with this genre then you’ll probably find this game a breeze to play through, although one or two levels did have a rather odd difficulty spike. This won’t be a game that people will obsess over, but it will neatly occupy someone for an afternoon.

reviewText:
It's a really simple and short game that gets a vote UP due to a simple fact - there's really nothing wrong with it.

You control a Leprichaun and you need to collect all the clovers in each level (~35 of them) for the exit door to appear. You have 60 seconds to do that on each level and it's usually more than enough. And that's it.

Short and easy. With two easy achievements.
voteText: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
You know the thing that retro platformers try to do, that they so often fail at?

Yeah, that thing is called gameplay. Graphics you can beg, borrow, or steal, but this has the gameplay of an honest-to-goodness NES title. It's hard to quantify, but it FEELS good. The physics is simple, the controls obey you, and once you figure out what you're doing, it's all about those gratifying little successes.

Will it change anybody's life? Maybe not, but plenty of NES titles were not this much actual fun.

reviewText:
This is another one of those games where I wish there was a neutral option.

It's cheap, it's fun for a while and it's good to encourage developers to keep making new games, so I'm giving it thumbs up.

Having said that, the controls are somewhat slidey". It's difficult to jump and grab a ladder without being right under it. You will often slide off and fall if you try to run and jump to it. Moving platforms are easy to miss and fall to your death
